title: Intermediate / Senior Electrical Engineer NEW!
full_description: At this time, we are looking to expand our team in our Windsor ON office and require an Intermediate/Senior Electrical Engineer with a minimum of 3+ years’ experience to support current and future projects for our clients.Qualifications:Bachelor’s degree in Electrical Engineering3+ years’ experience in industrial and/or facility engineeringProfessional Engineer (P. Eng) designation in Ontario required or can be obtained in short orderRegistered Professional Engineer (P.E.) in Michigan considered an assetExperience performing design in a manufacturing/industrial environment. Preferably in distribution and automationProficiency with/exposure to;Power modeling software (ETAP, EasyPower, and/or SKM).Design/drafting capability would be considered an asset (AutoCAD, MicroStation, Revit).Lighting system software utilization.Demonstrated knowledge of relevant electrical codes, safety and environmental legislation and regulationsAdvanced computer skills in Microsoft Office Software including Project requiredExperience with the design and engineering analysis of complex electrical systems and issuesExperience creating Bid documents, focusing on scope creationSome controls work experience (PLC, HMI)Highly motivated, with superb interpersonal and leadership skillsExcellent communication skills both written and verbal, the ability to speak multiple languages is considered an assetAble to communicate ideas and recommendations to non-engineer team members in a clear mannerYou must be a self-starter and be able to work in a fast paced, team setting.Interest in acquiring experience completing equipment inspections on-site (client, vendor, etc.) and to assess electrical and communication infrastructure.Work experience designing HV substations, hydroelectric plants, MV and LV distribution systems, and large electrical systems requiredWork experience with fire alarms, lighting and emergency power generation preferredStrong problem identification and problem resolution skillsAble to apply right mathematical methods and formulas to problem solvingAble to create alternative solutions to problemsExcellent time management and project management skillsHigh level of sound and independent judgment and reasoningDemonstrated ability to exercise necessary cost control measuresEffective leadership skills requiredLEED Accreditation would also be considered an assetWillingness to travel both domestically and internationallyMUST be eligible to apply for a TN to work in the US **Those with examples with their work would be given preference.Responsibilities and Duties:The Electrical Engineer is responsible but not limited to the following:Completion of fit-for-purpose designs that meet the client’s needs and requests.Preparation of quality reports and calculation packages as project deliverables.Work with supervising engineers and designers on various projects collaboratively to complete design drawings with appropriate level of detail.Interfacing with other disciplines and project management to execute the project as per plan.Technical experience in one or more of the following areas is considered an asset:Electrical infrastructure and power distribution (up to 25kV systems).System engineering (process control and instrumentation design).Lighting design and modelling.Communication system engineering (Fibre optic, Ethernet, Radio, etc.).Assures quality by designing electrical testing methods; testing finished products and system capabilities.Ensure designs are cost effective and meet required performance objectives through specification review and the practical application of engineering principles, design procedures, and industry standards.Perform assessments for clients to identify potential energy saving projects and assist preparing business cases for investment in energy efficiency.Review and check all assigned project electrical installation drawings for compliance with all company and project instructions (One-line diagrams, electrical equipment location drawings, plan drawings, details, schematics, wiring diagrams, etc.) including vendor technical submittals for installation requirements.Operate computer-assisted engineering and design software and equipment to perform engineering tasks.Design, implement, maintain, and improve electrical instruments, equipment, facilities, components, products, and systems for commercial, industrial, and domestic purposesConfer with engineers, customers, and others to discuss existing or potential engineering projects and products.Perform detailed calculations to compute and establish manufacturing, construction, and installation standards and specifications.Prepare specifications for purchase of materials and equipment.Prepare electrical calculations in accordance with the relevant Canadian, American and International Standards.Prepare proposals and estimate of man hour budgets.Provide day to day electrical support for ongoing field operations, required to conduct field checks.Compile data and write reports regarding existing and potential engineering studies and projects.Oversee project production efforts to assure projects are completed satisfactorily, on time and within budget.Salary based on experience______________________________________SNP Technical Services Inc. is an equal opportunity employer. We welcome and encourage applications from all people. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process. Only those interested in will be contacted.
